definitions.title: n.f.
definitions.body: gift, tribute, offering (NH id.; Ph. [[מנחת]]; Targum [[מִנְחָתָא]]; on Ar.v. supr.);—abs. ´[[מ]] Ge 4:3 + 81 t.; cstr. [[מִנְחַת]] Le 2:7 + 22 t.; sf. [[מִנְחָתִי]] Ge 33:10 + 3 t.; + 41 t. sfs. sg.; pl. sf. [[מִנְחׂתֶיְ]] Ps 20:4; [[מִנְחׂתֵיבֶם]] Nu 29:39, Am 5:22; —†

offering made to God, of any kind, whether grain or animals Ge 4:3, Ge 4:4, Ge 4:5, Nu 16:15 (J), 1Sa 2:17, 1Sa 2:29, 1Sa 26:19, Is 1:13, Ps 96:8, Zep 3:10; + (prob.) [[עֲלוֹת הַ֫מִּנְחָה]]([[לַ]]) 1Ki 18:29, 1Ki 18:36, 2Ki 3:20 (Ephr.; usually regarded as = [[מִנְחַת עֶרֶב]], but that much later usage). This gen. meaning poss. an also in foll.; [[זבח ומנחה]] 1Sa 2:29 (see v:1Sa 2:29 b), 1Sa 3:14, Is 19:21; [[עלה ומנחה]] Je 14:12; ‖[[עולה]] Ps 20:4; ‖[[שֶׁלֶם]] Am 5:22 ([[עׂלוֹת]] gloss, to explain [[אָרִיחַ]]); or these may shew early stage of discrimination. †

grain offering (whether raw, roasted, ground to flour, or prepared as bread or cakes, see below. AV meat offering, misleading < RV meal-offering. GFM:Jdg 322 renders cereal oblation);—[[יׇבִיאוּ אֶת־הַמִּנְחָה בִּכְלִי טָהוֹר]] Is 66:20 they bring the grain offering in clean vessels (restored Jews are brought as such an offering), cf. [[מנחה טהורה]] Mal 1:11; brought in hands Je 41:5 (late addit. Co); received from hands Mal 1:10; [[חִטִּים למנחה]] 1Ch 21:23 wheat for grain offering; [[סׂלֶת]] 1Ch 23:29, mixed with oil Ez Eze 46:14, baked v:Eze 46:20; disting. from other offerings 1Ki 8:64, 1Ki 8:64 = 2Ch 7:7, 2Ki 16:13, 2Ki 16:15, 2Ki 16:15, 2Ki 16:15, Is 43:23, Is 57:6, Is 66:3, Je 17:26, Je 33:18, Je 41:5 (late editors Co), Ez Eze 42:13, Eze 44:29, Eze 45:15, Eze 45:17, Eze 45:17, Eze 45:25, Da 9:27, Ps 40:7; used alone Ne 13:5, Ne 13:9, Ez Eze 45:24, Eze 46:5, Eze 46:5, Eze 46:7, Eze 46:11, Eze 46:14, Eze 46:14, Eze 46:15, Mal 1:13, Mal 2:12, Mal 2:13, Mal 3:3, Mal 3:4, Ju Jdg 13:19, Jdg 13:23 (R, G.FM:Jdg 322); [[עֶרֶב מִנְחַת]] ([[הָ]]) evening grain offering 2Ki 16:15, Ezr 9:4, Ezr 9:5, Da 9:21, Ps 141:2; [[מִנְחַת הַתָּמִיד]] continual grain off. Ne 10:34, cf. Le 6:13, Nu 4:16 (all cases under
grain-offering, always with this meaning in P, in classifications Ex 30:9, Ex 40:29, Le 7:37, Le 23:37, Nu 18:9, Nu 29:39; —

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: [[אָבִיב]] grain in the ear parched with fire, with oil and frankincense Le 2:14, Le 2:15.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: [[סׂלֶת]] fine flour with oil and frankincense Le 2:1, Le 6:7; elsewhere [[בְּלוּלָה בַּשֶּׁמֶן]] mingled with oil Le 14:10, Le 14:21, Le 23:13, Nu 7:13 + 10 t. Nu 8:8, Nu 15:4, Nu 15:6, Nu 15:9, Nu 28:5 + 6 t. Nu 29:3, Nu 29:9, Nu 29:14, except sin offering of very poor where offered without oil and frankincense Le 5:11–Le 5:13.

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: [[סׂלֶת]] baked in an oven as [[חַלּוֹת]] perforated cakes, or [[רְקִיקִים]] flat cakes Le 2:4, Le 7:9, Nu 6:15, [[על הַמַּחֲבַת]] on a flat pan Le 2:5, Le 6:14, Le 7:9, or [[מַרְחֶשֶׁת]] frying pan Le 2:7, Le 7:9. All these always unleavened ([[מַצּוֹת]]) and mixed with oil and salt Le 2:11–Le 2:13.

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: at Pentecost to consecrate new bread, [[מִנְחָה חֲדָשָׁה]] new grain offering of two loaves of leavened bread Le 23:16, Le 23:17, Nu 28:26

definitions.title: e.
definitions.body: barley meal without oil or incense; [[מִנְחַת קְנׇאׂת]] grain offering of jealousy, [[זִכָּרוֹן]] ´[[מ]] Nu 5:15, Nu 5:18, Nu 5:25. Cf. phrases [[מִנְחַת הַבּׂקֶר]] morning oblation Ex 29:41, Nu 28:8; ´[[קָרְבַּן מ]] Le 2:1, Le 2:4, Le 2:13; [[בִּכּוּרִים]] ´[[מ]] Le 2:14; [[פִּתִּים]] ´[[מ]] Le 6:14.
